alert.note: Alert for Lea (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 01 at 4:27PM MDT until May 01 at 5:15PM MDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT/515 PM MDT/ FOR NORTHEASTERN LEA AND NORTHWESTERN GAINES COUNTIES... At 526 PM CDT/426 PM MDT/, a severe thunderstorm was located 13 miles west of Denver City, moving east at 5 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR CENTRAL EASTERN LEA COUNTY AND NORTHWEST GAINES COUNTY. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and tennis ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Extensive tree damage and power outages are likely. Locations impacted include... Higginbotham. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT/900 PM MDT/ for southeastern New Mexico...and western Texas. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
